item.title: Nat MP tells Ardern to 'stick to her knitting' after her anger at Warehouse job cuts
item.description:
National's finance spokesman Paul Goldsmith says Prime Minister should "stick to her knitting" after expressing her fury at The Warehouse Group's mass job cuts.

item.nzh-sem:metakeywords: National, Coronavirus, Diseases, Health, Health and Wellbeing, Public Healthcare, Hospitals
item.title: 'You slept for a month': Meet NZ's last Covid-19 hospital patient
item.description:
By Indira Stewart of RNZ
When New Zealand's last hospitalised Covid-19 patient was sedated in ICU for over a month, doctors feared she would not survive and told her family to prepare to say their ...
item.author: newsfeeds@nzherald.co.nz

enclosure.url: https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202024/corona4_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=After four weeks in ICU with coronavirus, Lilian Su'a was taken off sedatives and began breathing on her own. Photo / RNZ
https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202024/corona2_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Lilian is finally at home with her family. Photo / RNZ
https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202024/lillian2_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Lilian Su'a, New Zealand's last hospitalised Covid-19 patient, and husband Tofiga. Photo / RNZ
https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202024/lillian_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Tofiga and Lilian Su'a with their grandaughter. Photo / RNZ

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202024/SCCZEN_150420NZHMCWEDNESDAY01_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Tofiga Su'a couldn't see his wife in Middlemore Hospital for a month as she battled the coronavirus during lockdown. Photo / Michael Craig
